TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ListControlDesigner extends System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataBoundControlDesigner

Docs.summary: Serves as the base class for designers that provide design-time support in the Visual Web Designer for controls that are derived from the abstract class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks In the Visual Web Designer, when the user switches from Source to Design view, the markup source code that describes a control derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl> class is parsed and a design-time version of the control is created on the design surface. When the user switches back to Source view, the design-time control is persisted to the markup source code and edited into the markup for the Web page. The ListControlDesigner class serves as the base class for designers that provide design-time support in the Visual Web Designer for controls that are derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl>.
The ListControlDesigner class properties provide the following functionality:
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner.ActionLists%2A> property returns a <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection> object, which typically contains an object that is derived from the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList> object for each level in the inheritance tree of the designer.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner.DataTextField%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner.DataValueField%2A> properties provide access to the corresponding properties of a control that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl> class. The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner.DataTextField%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner.DataValueField%2A> indicate the fields of the data source that provide the text and value content of the list items, respectively.
The ListControlDesigner class methods provide the following functionality:
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner.DataBind%2A> method binds the associated control that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl> to a design-time data source.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> method returns the markup that is used to render the associated control at design time.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner.GetSelectedDataSource%2A> method returns the design-time <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControlDesigner.DataSource%2A> component from the associated control container.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner.GetResolvedSelectedDataSource%2A> method returns the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControlDesigner.DataSource%2A> from the control container, resolved to the design-time <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataBoundControlDesigner.DataMember%2A> property of the control.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner.Initialize%2A> method prepares the designer to view and design the associated control that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl>.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner.OnDataSourceChanged%2A> method is called when the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControlDesigner.DataSource%2A> for the associated control has changed.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner.PreFilterProperties%2A> method is used to remove additional properties from, add additional properties to, or shadow properties of the associated control that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl>.
## Examples This section provides two code examples. The first demonstrates how to derive a custom control designer. The second demonstrates how to associate a derived control with a designer.
The following code example shows how to create a class named `SimpleRadioButtonListDesigner` that inherits from the ListControlDesigner class. The `SimpleRadioButtonListDesigner` class overrides the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner.Initialize%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner.OnDataSourceChanged%2A> methods. The `SimpleRadioButtonListDesigner` class displays a `SimpleRadioButtonList` control on the design surface.
[!code-cs[ListControlDesigner_Samples#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.ui.design.w_17_1.cs)] [!code-vb[ListControlDesigner_Samples#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.ui.design.w_17_1.vb)]
The following code example derives the `SimpleRadioButtonList` control from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList> control, and shows how to use the <xref:System.ComponentModel.DesignerAttribute> class to associate the `SimpleRadioButtonList` control with its designer, the `SimpleRadioButtonListDesigner` class.
[!code-cs[ListControlDesigner_Samples#5](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.ui.design.w_17_2.cs)] [!code-vb[ListControlDesigner_Samples#5](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.ui.design.w_17_2.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The .NET Framework internally constructs a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner> class when it creates the associated control that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl> class on the design surface.

Docs.summary: Gets the designer action list collection for the designer.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void DataBind(class System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl dataBoundControl) cil managed

Docs.param: The associated control derived from the , or a copy of that control.
Docs.summary: Binds the specified control to the design-time data source.

remarks.format:
## Remarks For the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataBoundControlDesigner> base class, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataBoundControlDesigner.DataBind%2A> method sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl.DataSource%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl.DataSourceID%2A> properties of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl> object to reference the design-time data source, then calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl.DataBind%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method, and then restores the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl.DataSource%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl.DataSourceID%2A> properties to their original values.
For the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner> class, however, the DataBind method has no functionality, because <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem> objects were just added to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.Items%2A> collection.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the data text field of the control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The DataTextField property sets or retrieves the markup to use for the design-time representation of the control at run time. This provides access via the designer to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.DataTextField%2A> property of the associated control, which corresponds to the field of the data source that provides the text content of the list items.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the data value field of the control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The DataValueField property provides access via the designer to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.DataValueField%2A> property of the associated control, which indicates the field of the data source that provides the value content of the list items.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance string GetDesignTimeHtml() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets the HTML that is used to represent the control at design time.
Docs.returns: A <xref:System.String> containing the markup used to render the control derived from the at design time.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If the associated control derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl> object is data-bound, the GetDesignTimeHtml method clears the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.Items%2A> collection and adds a <xref:System.String> message indicating the control is data-bound. If the associated control is not data-bound and the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.Items%2A> collection is empty, the GetDesignTimeHtml adds a <xref:System.String> message indicating the control is unbound. Then, the GetDesignTimeHtml calls its base method to generate the markup.
## Examples The following code example overrides the GetDesignTimeHtml method to customize the markup that is displayed for the associated control on a design surface. If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.BackColor%2A> property is not defined for the associated control, it is set to `Gainsboro`, and the control is displayed with that background color. After this is done, the base implementation of the GetDesignTimeHtml method is called.
This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner> class.
[!code-cs[ListControlDesigner_Samples#2](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.web.ui.design.w_13_1.cs)] [!code-vb[ListControlDesigner_Samples#2](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.web.ui.design.w_13_1.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Collections.IEnumerable GetResolvedSelectedDataSource() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets the data source component from the associated control container, resolved to a specific data member.
Docs.returns: An <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerable> containing the design-time <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControlDesigner.DataSource%2A>, resolved to the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataBoundControlDesigner.DataMember%2A> of the associated control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner.GetSelectedDataSource%2A> method returns `null` if a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControlDesigner.DataSource%2A> property is not found, or if a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControlDesigner.DataSource%2A> with the same name does not exist.
If the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControlDesigner.DataSource%2A> cannot be resolved to the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataBoundControlDesigner.DataMember%2A> property of the associated control, the GetResolvedSelectedDataSource returns an <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerable> interface containing the design-time <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControlDesigner.DataSource%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance object GetSelectedDataSource() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets the data source component from the associated control container.
Docs.returns: An object implementing an <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerable> interface and containing the design-time <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControlDesigner.DataSource%2A> of the associated control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The GetSelectedDataSource method returns `null` if a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControlDesigner.DataSource%2A> property is not found, or if a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControlDesigner.DataSource%2A> with the same name does not exist.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void Initialize(class System.ComponentModel.IComponent component) cil managed

Docs.param: A control derived from the that implements an .
Docs.summary: Prepares the designer to view, edit, and design the associated control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The designer host calls the Initialize method when it is ready to use the designer to render the control that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl> class. The Initialize method and its base methods configure properties and connect to events that are necessary for the operation of the designer.
The `component` parameter is the control, derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl>, that is associated with this designer or is a copy of that control.
## Examples The following code example overrides the Initialize method in a designer derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner> class to ensure that only instances of a control class named `SimpleRadioButtonList` are used by the custom designer.
This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner> class.
[!code-cs[ListControlDesigner_Samples#3](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/cf83bf5c-1e4a-4285-82ef-_1.cs)] [!code-vb[ListControlDesigner_Samples#3](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/cf83bf5c-1e4a-4285-82ef-_1.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnDataSourceChanged() cil managed

Docs.summary: Called when the data source for the associated control has changed.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControlDesigner.OnDataSourceChanged%2A> base method connects the associated control that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl> object to the current data source and, if that is different from the data source to which the control was connected, updates the design-time markup. The OnDataSourceChanged method updates the design-time markup after connecting to the current data source.
## Examples The following code example overrides the OnDataSourceChanged method in a class that inherits from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner> class. When the data source that is associated with the designer class changes, the OnDataSourceChanged method is called and this code sets a variable named `changedDataSource` to `true`.
This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner> class.
[!code-cs[ListControlDesigner_Samples#4](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.web.ui.design.w_11_1.cs)] [!code-vb[ListControlDesigner_Samples#4](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.web.ui.design.w_11_1.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void OnDataSourceChanged(bool forceUpdateView) cil managed

Docs.param: A <xref:System.Boolean> that indicates whether the design-time markup is to be unconditionally updated. This parameter is ignored.
Docs.summary: Called when the data source for the associated control has changed.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControlDesigner.OnDataSourceChanged%2A> base method connects the associated control that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl> class to the current data source and, if that is different from the data source to which the control was connected, updates the design-time markup. The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner.OnDataSourceChanged%2A> method of the designer unconditionally updates the design-time markup after connecting to the current data source. The value of `forceUpdateView` is ignored.
## Examples The following code example overrides the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner.OnDataSourceChanged%2A> method in a class that inherits from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner> class. When the data source that is associated with the designer class changes, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner.OnDataSourceChanged%2A> is called and this code sets a variable named `changedDataSource` to `true`.
This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner> class.
[!code-cs[ListControlDesigner_Samples#4](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/05106d94-2057-4a29-9d49-_1.cs)] [!code-vb[ListControlDesigner_Samples#4](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/05106d94-2057-4a29-9d49-_1.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void PreFilterProperties(class System.Collections.IDictionary properties) cil managed

Docs.param: A collection implementing the <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary> of the added or shadowed properties to expose for the associated control at design time.
Docs.summary: Used by the designer to remove additional properties from or add properties to the display in the **Properties** grid or to shadow properties of the associated control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Control designers use methods that are derived from the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentDesigner.PreFilterProperties%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to shadow various control properties with corresponding design-time properties that the designer implements, and to add properties to or remove properties from the **Properties** grid.
For controls that are derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl> object, the PreFilterProperties adds the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DataFieldConverter> attribute to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.DataTextField%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.DataValueField%2A> properties of the associated control.

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the associated control should render its default action lists.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The UseDataSourcePickerActionList property returns `false` so that a data source dropdown is not displayed with the **Choose Data Source** menu item in the **Common Tasks** context menu. Instead, this menu item displays the **Choose Data Source** dialog box, which allows the user to select a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl.DataSource%2A> and the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.DataTextField%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.DataValueField%2A> properties.
